titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller Brothers Fund records, West Africa Program, RG 5
A Guide to the Rockefeller Brothers Fund records, West Africa Program, RG 5 FA1766

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-29 00:37:13 -0500.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Brothers Fund records, West Africa Program, RG 5

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The West Africa Program of the Rockefeller Brothers Fund, launched late in 1957, was designed to provide technical assistance tailored to the economic development needs of Ghana and Nigeria. While the Fund's original resolve to aid Liberia in the same manner proved unfruitful, the Republic of Togo also became a beneficiary of this program in a minor way.

Under the limits established by the Fund, the West Africa Program did not operate as a grant-making agency. At the request of ministries in one of the African governments involved or of a private group of investors and industrialists, the Fund contracted with outside consultants to prepare "feasibility studies." Each of these studies dealt in depth with a specific aspect of the concerned nation's economic potential or needs and was designed to provide a realistic framework for later action. The Fund's responsibility ended with the submission of these studies to the appropriate agencies or private groups.

The Program's main office in Lagos, Nigeria was also a distribution point for these studies. Its director, Robert I. Fleming, acted as a liaison between the governments of Togo, Ghana, and Nigeria and groups of U.S. investors. The Lagos office organized investigative tours for these investors and arranged their contacts with governmental personnel.
The West Africa Program of the Rockefeller Brothers Fund was concluded at the end of 1962.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records of the West Africa Program include correspondence from the New York and Lagos offices, memoranda, reports, administrative and financial materials, personnel correspondence, and a complete set of feasibility studies contracted by the Rockefeller Brothers Fund. The bulk of this material dates between 1957 and 1963, the period during which the Lagos office was in full operation.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records of the West Africa Program are divided into three series:
Note: These records were reviewed and partially weeded by Rockefeller Brothers Fund officials in 1968. At that time the original filing order of the documents was not retained.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: All material more than ten years old is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Brothers Fund retains literary rights to this collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records of the Rockefeller Brothers Fund West Africa Program were deposited with the Rockefeller Archive Center on January 10, 1979 and later donated to RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, memoranda, reports, financial and administrative material, personnel correspondence and news releases.

scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, memoranda, and reports related to projects undertaken in Togo, Ghana, and Nigeria.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains copies of studies contracted by the Rockefeller Brothers Fund regarding economic development prospects in Togo, Ghana, and Nigeria.
